title: Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah agree to a ceasefire, started on Wednesday
summary: The ceasefire marks the first major step toward ending the regionwide unrest triggered by Hamas' attack on Israel on October 7, 2023. But it does not address the devastating war in Gaza, where Hamas is still holding dozens of hostages.

title: Trade tensions flare over Donald Trump's tariff announcements
summary: The US president-elect has threatened to impose new tariffs not only on imports from Chinese but also those from Canada and, above all, Mexico. He accused the latter of being a gateway for products from China and for fentanyl, a synthetic drug that is wreaking havoc in the US.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro 'fully aware' of plan to murder Lula, in 2022 Coup Plot
summary: A report was made public on Tuesday by the Supreme Court judge overseeing the case, Alexandre de Moraes – one of the targets of the alleged assassination plot.

title: In China, a string of deadly attacks worries both population and authorities
summary: At least a dozen attacks have erupted since the start of the year, with schools emerging as a particularly vulnerable target. In a nation that prides itself on security, the escalating pattern of violence has triggered widespread alarm, with many commentators interpreting the incidents as a form of 'revenge on society.'

title: France risks budget crisis as opposition threatens to topple government
summary: With the left and the far right openly considering the possibility of toppling Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government in the coming weeks, the country could find itself in a state of unprecedented uncertainty, further weakening investor confidence.

title: Is Antoine Dupont really the best rugby sevens player? The real surprise is that he won no award in 15s
summary: The Toulouse scrum-half was rewarded for his achievements in sevens, having carried France to the Olympic title despite little experience. But it is above all for his exploits in rugby unions that he deserves an award, writes Le Monde's Valentin Moinard.

title: Australia's parliament passes bill that would ban young children from social media
summary: If the bill becomes law this week after being debated in the Senate, the platforms would have one year to work out how to implement the age restrictions before the penalties are enforced.

title: Tariffs: 'American trade restrictions worsened the 1929 market crash and accelerated its spread to Europe'
summary: In 1930, the US sharply increased its tariffs, exacerbating the Great Depression. At a time when Donald Trump has made this measure one of his economic priorities, columnist Eric Albert argues it is a lesson not to be repeated.

title: Mexico suggests it would impose its own tariffs to retaliate against any Trump tariffs
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose 25% import duties on Mexican goods if the country doesn't stop the flow of drugs and migrants across the border.

title: France key bond spread hits 12-year high
summary: Ratings agency S&P is preparing to publish a new evaluation of France's public debt on Friday whilst Moody's and Fitch each gave France a negative outlook in reports last month.

title: French presidency denies reported Macron 'government to fall' comment
summary: The newspaper 'Le Parisien' stood by its reporting as the Elysée Palace denied via its X account that President Emmanuel Macron told guests he thought the opposition would topple the government.

title: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo to Le Monde: 'I won't be running for a third term'
summary: The Socialist mayor first elected in 2014 says she would like Senator Rémi Féraud, the leader of the majority group on the Paris council, to succeed her. The next elections are in 2026.

title: Champions League: Bayern Munich beat struggling PSG 1-0
summary: With just three games remaining, even making the knockouts is not a given for the French champions, who are in 26th spot – outside the playoff placings. PSG will host Manchester City in January, along with facing tricky away trips to Red Bull Salzburg and Stuttgart.

title: Prosecutors seek up to 15-year terms for French rape trial defendants
summary: On Monday, prosecutors requested a maximum 20-year jail term for Dominique Pelicot, who has been on trial since September with 49 other men for organizing the repeated rape and sexual abuse of Gisèle Pelicot, now his former wife.

title: Champions League: Barca beat Brest, with Lewandowski hitting century
summary: Brest fall a few places down the table but their strong start to the campaign means they are well placed to secure at least a play-off spot, while Barcelona are aiming to reach the last 16 directly.

title: David Lammy, UK foreign secretary: 'Our number one priority in foreign policy terms is a European reset'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde and two other European newspapers, the head of the Foreign Office insisted on London's continued aid to Ukraine and its desire to strengthen defense cooperation with the European Union's 27 member states.

title: Carrefour attempts damage control against Brazil 'boycott'
summary: The French supermarket group Carrefour tried  to end a supplier 'boycott' of its stores in Brazil by apologizing for refusing to sell Mercosur-origin meat in its outlets in France

title: Macron's chief of staff can face conflict-of-interest trial, court rules
summary: Alexis Kohler can be prosecuted on suspicion of illegally favoring a company to which he had family ties while working as a senior civil servant from 2009 to 2016.

title: EU approves French budget promises without quite believing them
summary: On Tuesday, November 26, the European Commission gave its approval to the French government's plan to gradually reduce its public deficit until 2029. Without, however, fully endorsing the forecasts presented by Prime Minister Michel Barnier.

title: 51 men are standing trial for the rapes of Gisèle Pelicot. Here's who they are and what they said in court
summary: Fifty-one men of all ages, professions and origins have been on trial in Avignon, southern France, since September. All but one, who is on the run, took the stand to explain their background and their involvement in the rapes of Gisèle Pelicot as she was drugged by her husband Dominique Pelicot. Many of them denied any guilt, despite video evidence. Here are their profiles.

title: From the Musée d'Orsay to the Grand Palais, the mischievous eye of Nicolas Krief
summary: From 2010 to 2023, photographer Nicolas Krief traveled to major French and European museums capturing moments visitors never see: the installation of an exhibition. His often mischievous images reveal an unprecedented dialogue between works of art – and those who handle them. The series has been compiled in a book, 'Musée,' just published by Editions Gallimard.

title: In Valencia, the 'Z,' 'Alpha' and 'glass' generations are proving to be less fragile and more resourceful than they appear
summary: 'Our youth deserve our praises. Without them, I don't know how we'd get by,' said one shop owner, standing amid the wreckage of her devastated shop. Young adults in their twenties have converged from across the country in the aftermath of the torrential floods that struck on October 29th, mounting a grassroots relief effort that has become a testament to generational solidarity and resilience.

title: 'COPs are part of the barrier against the populist storm that is sweeping the planet'
summary: Despite minimal agreement and obstruction from oil-producing countries, the climate conference is proof that multilateralism is not dead according to sociologist Stefan Aykut, in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Trump, saved by American voters, escapes federal prosecution for attempt to overturn 2020 election
summary: Special Counsel Jack Smith emphasized the 'unprecedented circumstances' and 'gravity of the crimes' at the heart of the indictments but had to back down in the face of the immunity the president-elect will enjoy once in office.

title: Le Pen's party ideas are taking root, but so is doubt about its ability to govern
summary: Nearly four out of ten people support the far-right Rassemblement National party's ideas, according to an annual barometer of its image conducted by the Verian institute for Le Monde.

title: 'Le Pen relishes kingmaker role, holding Barnier's fate in her hands'
summary: The 2025 budget negotiations have put Marine Le Pen's daughter back in the saddle, with her demands and strategies making other political players become subordinate figures, notes Françoise Fressoz in her column.

title: Stunned by Trump's victory, progressive US media asks itself questions
summary: Left-leaning news channels have seen their ratings plummet since the Republican candidate's victory, leading the liberal media to question their positioning in relation to the president-elect.

title: EU-Mercosur trade deal: French lawmakers overwhelmingly reject treaty in non-binding vote
summary: Prime Minister Michel Barnier had hoped for a unanimous vote in support of the government's declaration opposing the signing of the free trade agreement between the European Union and Mercosur, to strengthen his position in Brussels. However, MPs from the radical left did not support him.

title: Ceasefire in Lebanon takes effect after two months of open conflict between Israel and Hezbollah
summary: The agreement provides for a 60-day phase during which Israeli troops will evacuate the south of the country, in parallel with a withdrawal of Hezbollah forces north of the Litani River.

title: EU-Mercosur trade deal: Poland joins France in attempt to form a blocking minority
summary: In addition to Paris and Warsaw, Austria, Belgium and the Netherlands are also concerned about the free-trade agreement's impact on their agricultural sectors. Yet, at this stage, they have not all committed themselves.

title: ICC prosecutor requests arrest warrant for leader of Myanmar's military junta
summary: Senior General Min Aung Hlaing is accused of crimes against humanity for the deportation and persecution of the Rohingya.

title: France says 'immunities' apply to Netanyahu regarding ICC arrest warrant
summary: In a statement, the foreign ministry said France would 'respect its international obligations' but added that the Israeli leader was covered by immunity rules that apply to states that are not a party to the ICC.

title: 'Presidential immunity, which Trump perceives as absolute, could lead to future impunity'
summary: In the United States, Trump's impunity implied by the transition will play as much a role in domestic affairs as in foreign relations, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: The Sun as seen by Solar Orbiter
summary: The probe, piloted by the European Space Agency, has revealed images of the daytime star of unparalleled quality.

title: Trump's tariffs put Canada's trade at risk
summary: Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on Canadian products has caused panic in Ottawa. If the threat is implemented, Canada would have a lot to lose, as three-quarters of its exports are sent to the US.
